title: Analysis of Online Learning Dissatisfaction Factors and Improvement Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A competency-enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Based on individual online learning experiences, analyze issues within social contexts and derive practical improvement strategies using mixed methodologies and user-centered design

learning_goals: Learners analyze at least three social and technical dissatisfaction factors in online learning.
Learners diagnose online learning issues using mixed-method approaches (surveys, interviews, observations).
Learners propose online learning improvement strategies aligned with user-centered design principles.
Learners continuously monitor and improve their learning processes through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
